poem:
Title: "In the Realm of Definition"

The morning newspaper,
reddened with men's definitions,
Unveils a new sting.
In the heart of freedom's speech,
Gove's knife sinks - cold and metallic.

A bristle of words,
meant for the milder rebels,
We who speak our thoughts untreated,
find ourselves, with shock,
strangers in our own discourse.

Extremist, they call—
with irreversible judgement,
Injustice, ghoulishly masked,
in the garb of virtue's restraint.
